author: Paul Graham
content: Prestige is an ok motivator, but curiosity is a better one. Curiosity never lies.

author: Orange Book
content: Everyone has a period when they just “disappear” and work on themselves until they figure out what they truly want.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
content: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness, I want sin.

title: On Liberty
author: J.S. Mill
content: Judgement is given to men that they may use it. Because it may be used erroneously, are men to be told that they ought not to use it at all? To prohibit what they think pernicious is not claiming exemption from error, but fulfilling the duty incumbent on them, although fallible, of acting on their conscientious conviction. If we were never to act on our opinions, because those opinions may be wrong, we should leave all our interested uncared for, and all our duties unperformed.

title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
content: One must still have chaos in oneself to give birth to a dancing star.
